intro: Navia serrulata, commonly known as the serrated navia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Navia serrulata typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
